front.title: Header Protection for Cryptographically Protected E-mail

abstract.t: S/MIME version 3.1 introduced a mechanism to provide end-to-end cryptographic protection of e-mail message headers. However, few implementations generate messages using this mechanism, and several legacy implementations have revealed rendering or security issues when handling such a message. This document updates the S/MIME specification to offer a different mechanism that provides the same cryptographic protections but with fewer downsides when handled by legacy clients. The header protection schemes described here are also applicable to messages with PGP/MIME cryptographic protections. Furthermore, this document offers more explicit guidance for clients when generating or handling e-mail messages with cryptographic protection of message headers.
